posts.post_content: Quite possible one of the best cards ever printed that isn't banned or restricted in any format. For a mere 3-drop it gets rid of ANYTHING (creature, enchantment, artifact, land, or planeswalker). Worth splashing black in your white deck and vice versa, even for just this card alone.

Posted By: redshoesrock (5/13/2010 3:50:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is the most beautiful and elegant removal spell ever printed. It's a little strange, but I always feel "safe" with one of these in my hand. I know I'll be able to handle almost anything my opponent throws in my direction.
  
   
[Maelstrom Pulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Pulse) is good, but what if I need to take care of a [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy) or some other nuisance land?
  
   
Vindicate is and will always be the best removal spell ever printed.
posts.html:
This is the most beautiful and elegant removal spell ever printed. It's a little strange, but I always feel "safe" with one of these in my hand. I know I'll be able to handle almost anything my opponent throws in my direction.

Maelstrom Pulse is good, but what if I need to take care of a Tolarian Academy or some other nuisance land?

Vindicate is and will always be the best removal spell ever printed.

posts.post_content:
I love this card, it almost always will be usefull and it is fairly cheap considering.
  
   
Gets rid of:
  
Creatures,Enchantments,Artifacts,Planewalkers, and even lands!
  
   
Average creature and land removal usally costs three cmc anyways, as well as enchantment and artifacts averaging at about 2 cmc, and I can't say I know of much removal for planeswalkers so that makes this card all the better.

Posted By: Silverware (1/15/2010 8:42:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: No one seems to have pointed out that this can destroy basic lands. Being able to splash this into a black deck with [Scrubland](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scrubland)s and blow up cards like Moat is obviously amazing. but then to be able to redundantly annihilate your opponent's lands is the icing on the cake. You play first you maybe [Duress](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Duress) someone then your opponent grumbles plays a land passes their turn and you [Sinkhole](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sinkhole) them. Then they play another land and they pass and for the heck of it you Vindicate their next only land. You now have 4 lands they have 0. This is obviously very silly. Black cannot actually destroy enchantments. Nor can it do much about Artifacts.
posts.html:
No one seems to have pointed out that this can destroy basic lands. Being able to splash this into a black deck with Scrublands and blow up cards like Moat is obviously amazing. but then to be able to redundantly annihilate your opponent's lands is the icing on the cake. You play first you maybe Duress someone then your opponent grumbles plays a land passes their turn and you Sinkhole them. Then they play another land and they pass and for the heck of it you Vindicate their next only land. You now have 4 lands they have 0. This is obviously very silly. posts.post_content:
"you know, I hope this new card 'X' doesn't blow up in our faces, but EVEN if it does, thank God we printed that 'Break Glass Here' card back in Apocalypse. We should totally reprint that in the Return To Ravnica set. Everyone would go nuts, and it would keep the failsafe online through Modern for a LONG time." You wanna know who's a permanent, kiddies? [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor). Yeah.   
  
EDIT: Oh, my mistake. Apparently Wizards kinda-sorta-wanted to reprint this, and just had a change of heart about the Color Pie ness of it. Honestly, that's all to the good. White already has all the removal it needs. Green has some removal, but not enough. It's difficult to correctly design green removal without upsetting Vorthos:  
  
[Abrupt Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abrupt Decay): Black Green, Kill a Thing.
